programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a piece of playground equipment from a 1970s McDonald's and a portable record player.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.sub-title: David Copperfield: Rick Works His Magic
programme.desc: Illusionist David Copperfield calls on the staff to restore two items from his magic museum's collection, so Rick Dale and his team set out to complete the work for a profit.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: With a gruelling winter ahead, Jamie has employed his biggest heavy rescue team yet in preparation - and when a truck carrying a huge amount of lumber crashes, the team is faced with the first big wreck of the season.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A blind person who can visualise the environment by clicking his tongue and listening to the echo, another who is immune to electricity, and a strong man who can bend hammers.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The discovery of a San Diego girl's badly beaten body in a canyon in 1991, a case that unearthed a shocking truth which no one could believe.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams focus on classic British motors as they strip the most valuable parts off a Rolls-Royce and a Jaguar Sovereign. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, John Sessions, Alexander Armstrong and Alan Davies provide imaginative answers to host Stephen Fry's questions on topics including cheating, caravans and cuckoo clocks.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress and presenter Mel Giedroyc, heavyweight boxer David Haye, actor-musician Martin Kemp and comedian Romesh Ranganathan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed host Rob Brydon's liar of the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the comedy panel quiz, with questions relating to animals that start with the letter P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic comedy starring Will Forte returns for a third season. In the first episode, a group of armed intruders storm the beach in Malibu.

credits.actor: Will Forte returns for a third season

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Todd is feeling low over recent actions, so Tandy tells a few little white lies to try and cheer him up.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Paul Danan finally gets his day in court with Shaun Williamson after a pantomime-based fallout, while a husband is sick and tired of his miserly wife ruining Christmas.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene finds himself involved in multiple murder plots when the universally unpopular General Von Klinkerhoffen decides to become more involved in controlling the district.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: It is September 1943 and with the airmen having escaped to England and the Italian troops withdrawn from the area, Rene is hoping for a little peace and quiet. However, such expectations are dashed when Yvette announces she is expecting a baby. Festive episode of the comedy from 1991, starring Gorden Kaye and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Battle Factory
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how weapons are manufactured in military factories, from the smallest bolts through to machine guns and warships. The opening programme examines the Colt C7 Assault Rifle, a bombsuit made from pieces of hard plastic and bulletproof fabric, and a mortar.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lyell Centre has a new boss in the shape of forensic pathologist Thomas Chamberlain, but he is met with a frosty reception from Nikki, Jack and Clarissa, who are still coming to terms with the death of Leo. Meanwhile, detectives are demanding results in two unsolved cases involving a wealthy mother and son murdered in their London home and the disfigured body of a young woman. Starring Richard Lintern, Emilia Fox, David Caves, Kaye Wragg and Hugo Becker.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Ian King Live
programme.desc: All the day's business news live from Sky's City of London studio, with Ian King.

programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Not the Robbie Williams Christmas Show
programme.desc: In a one-off special recorded at London's Alexandra Palace Theatre, the singer performs classic hits, plus new Christmas songs. He's also joined by guests including David Walliams and Jamie Cullum.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five family members from Harrow, north-west London, answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: It's A 90s Christmas
programme.desc: The 90s was a special decade for Christmas music. So special in fact, we can't stop watching these Christmas video greats.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Takin' It Old Skool
programme.desc: We're takin' you back to the old skool with some of the best tracks from the last few decades.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: The Fresh List
programme.desc: Keep up to date with some of the hottest new videos dropping right now, from some of your favourite artists and introducing some brand new artists.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring the creation of classical guitars and fast tractor mowing machines. Plus, how climbers maintain the blades on wind turbines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini races in the Hershey Hill Climb and sells his Shelby Mustang GT 500 KR convertible at auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a well-known customer trade his 1931 Cadillac for a Model A and the car restorer is impressed by an exceptional collection of classics.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts goes behind the scenes of more moments of destruction, including two sports cars colliding at great speed and a massive explosion at a refinery.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Catastrophic flooding topples a hotel, a passenger falls from a hot-air balloon and dozens of drums filled with chemicals burst into flames. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: The team tries to make up for lost time in a new swamp, but washed out roads and broken equipment force unscheduled delays.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.sub-title: John Nivens' 1972 Lotus Europa - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A 1972 Lotus Europa was nominated by Jay Leno to be Overhauled for John Niven, who delivers soda every weekend to Jay Leno's Big Dog Garage.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A look at how a flight data recorder or 'black box' is often the only means of telling how an aeroplane crashed. However, the device sometimes generates more questions than answers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 15-year-old Elizabeth Ennen, who was last seen when a friend dropped her home. Police uncovered a piece of CCTV that turned the case in an unexpected direction.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into the abduction of a 17-year-old from a shop near his home and the subsequent $30,000 ransom demands.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency animal medical technicians come to the rescue of 17 emaciated pigs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Caitie and her wedding planner father clash over a gown, while Danielle lost her mother to cancer, so her dad steps in to help her make the big decision.
